13    /**
14    * File use to draw plots
15    * 
16    * This file contains a class used to draw plot's. It's dependent on graph.plot.class.php and evalmath.class.php.
17    * 
18    * @package WikiPlot
19    * @subpackage PlotClass
20    * @license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt GNU General Public License
21    * @author WikiPlot development team.
22    * @copyright Copyright 2006, WikiPlot development team.
23    */
24    
25    /**
26    *Includes EvalMath
27    *
28    *EvalMath is used to evaluate mathematical expressions in a safe environment.
29    */
30    require_once('evalmath.class.php');
31    
32    /**
33    *Includes Graph representation class
34    *
35    *Graph is used as a representation of a graph.
36    */
37    require_once('graph.plot.class.php');
38    
39    /**
40    * Class used to draw plots
41    * 
42    * Class containing functions to draw plots to an image.
43    * 
44    * @package WikiPlot
45    * @subpackage PlotClass
46    * @license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt GNU General Public License
47    * @author WikiPlot development team.
48    * @copyright Copyright 2006, WikiPlot development team.
49    */
50    class Plot
51    {
52        /**
53        * Graphs to plot
54        *
55        * Array containing list of Graphs to plot.
56        *
57        * @var array 
58        * @access public
59        * @see Graph
60        */
61        var $Graphs = array();
62    
63        /**
64        * Caption of the plot
65        * 
66        * Caption of the plot, will be shown as text centered on the final plot.
67        * Leave this variable as null if no Caption is wanted.
68        * 
69        * @var string 
70        * @access public
71        * @see DrawCaption
72        */
73        var $Caption = null;
74    
75        /**
76        * Caption font
77        * 
78        * Font of the Caption, the fonts 1-5 is built in, and behaves as different sizes.
79        * 
80        * @var integer 
81        * @access public
82        * @see DrawCaption
83        */
84        var $CaptionFont = 5;
85    
86        /**
87        * Width of output image
88        *
89        * The width of the output image, in pixels.
90        *
91        * @var integer 
92        * @access public
93        * @see DrawPlots
94        */
95        var $Width = 100;
96    
97        /**
98        * Height of output image
99        *
100       * The width of the output image, in pixels.
101       *
102       * @var integer 
103       * @access public
104       * @see DrawPlots
105       */
106       var $Height = 100;
107   
108       /**
109       * Minimum X
110       *
111       * Minimum X in coordinate space.
112       * Together with MaxX this variable defines width of the plot in coordinate space.
113       * This width may differ from width of the image, the coordinate will be scaled correctly.
114       *
115       * @var integer 
116       * @access public
117       * @see DrawPlots
118       * @see MaxX
119       */
120       var $MinX = -10;
121       /**
122       * Maximum X
123       *
124       * Maximum X in coordinate space.
125       * Together with MinX this variable defines width of the plot in coordinate space.
126       * This width may differ from width of the image, the coordinate will be scaled correctly.
127       *
128       * @var integer 
129       * @access public
130       * @see DrawPlots
131       * @see MinX
132       */
133       var $MaxX = 100;
134       /**
135       * Minimum Y
136       *
137       * Minimum Y in coordinate space.
138       * Together with MaxY this variable defines height of the plot in coordinate space.
139       * This height may differ from height of the image, the coordinate will be scaled correctly.
140       *
141       * @var integer 
142       * @access public
143       * @see DrawPlots
144       * @see MaxY
145       */
146       var $MinY = -10;
147       /**
148       * Maximum Y
149       *
150       * Maximum Y in coordinate space.
151       * Together with MinY this variable defines height of the plot in coordinate space.
152       * This height may differ from height of the image, the coordinate will be scaled correctly.
153       *
154       * @var integer 
155       * @access public
156       * @see DrawPlots
157       * @see MinY
158       */
159       var $MaxY = 100;
160   
161       /**
162       * Enable Axis
163       *
164       * Defaults to true and draws 2 axis.
165       *
166       * @var boolean 
167       * @access public
168       * @see DrawAxis
169       */
170       var $EnableAxis = true;
171       /**
172       * Enable Grid
173       *
174       * Defaults to true and draws a grid.
175       *
176       * @var boolean 
177       * @access public
178       * @see DrawGrid
179       */
180       var $EnableGrid = true;
181       /**
182       * Grid color
183       *
184       * Defaults to gray, and determains the color of the grid. This is an array of three integers, one for red, green and blue. Where integeres has values between 0 and 255.
185       * <code>
186       * var $Red = 240;
187       * var $Green = 240;
188       * var $Blue = 240;
189       * $this->GridColor = array($Red,$Green,$Blue);
190       * </code>
191       * 
192       * @var array 
193       * @access public
194       * @see DrawGrid
195       */
196       var $GridColor = array(240,240,240);
197       /**
198       * Grid font
199       * 
200       * Font of the grids labels, the fonts 1-5 is built in, and behaves as different sizes.
201       * 
202       * @var integer 
203       * @access public
204       * @see DrawGrid
205       */
206       var $GridFont = 1;
207       /**
208       * X grid space
209       * 
210       * Distance between grids on the x axis in coordinate space. Defaults to null, leave it null, if you want autogenerated gridspace.
211       * 
212       * @var integer 
213       * @access public
214       * @see GetXGridSpace
215       */
216       var $XGridSpace = null;
217       /**
218       * Y grid space
219       * 
220       * Distance between grids on the y axis in coordinate space. Defaults to null, leave it null, if you want autogenerated gridspace.
221       * 
222       * @var integer 
223       * @access public
224       * @see GetYGridSpace
225       */
226       var $YGridSpace = null;
227       /**
228       * Background color
229       *
230       * Color of the background when using auto ImageResource created by GeneratePlot().
231       *
232       * @var array 
233       * @access public
234       */
235       var $BackgroundColor = array(255,255,255);
236   
237       /**
238       *Generate hash
239       *
240       *Generates a uniqe hashsum (md5) for the plot, generated from all parameters.
241       *
242       *@uses $Caption
243       *@uses $CaptionFont
244       *@uses $Width
245       *@uses $Height
246       *@uses $MinX
247       *@uses $MaxX
248       *@uses $MinY
249       *@uses $MaxY
250       *@uses $EnableGrid
251       *@uses $GridColor
252       *@uses $GridFont
253       *@uses $EnableAxis
254       *@uses $XGridSpace
255       *@uses $YGridSpace
256       *@uses $Graphs
257       *@uses Graph::GetHash()
258       *@return string Hash representation of the object.
259       */
260       function GetHash()
261       {
262           $Hash  = "C:" . $this->Caption;
263           $Hash .= "F:" . $this->CaptionFont;
264           $Hash .= "W:" . $this->Width;
265           $Hash .= "H:" . $this->Height;
266           $Hash .= "X:" . $this->MinX . "_" . $this->MaxX;
267           $Hash .= "Y:" . $this->MinY . "_" . $this->MaxY;
268           $Hash .= "A:" . $this->EnableAxis;
269           $Hash .= "G:" . $this->EnableGrid . "_" . $this->GridColor . "_" . $this->GridFont;
270           $Hash .= "S:" . $this->XGridSpace . "_" . $this->YGridSpace;
271           $Hash .= "V:" . "$LastChangedRevision: 63 $";
272           foreach($this->Graphs as $key => $S)
273           {
274               $Hash .= "G:" . $key. "_" . $S->GetHash(); 
275           }
276           return md5($Hash);
277       }
278   
279       /**
280       *Get ImageResource of the plot
281       *
282       *Generates ImageResource representation of the plot.
283       *
284       *@access public
285       *@uses EnableGrid
286       *@uses DrawGrid()
287       *@uses $Width
288       *@uses $Height
289       *@uses $EnableAxis
290       *@uses DrawAxis()
291       *@uses DrawCaption()
292       *@uses DrawPlots()
293       *@uses $BackgroundColor
294       *@param ImageResource $ImageResource Defaults to null, will generate empty ImageResource.
295       *@param Boolean $ChangeSize May we change the size of the plot to fit given ImageResource?
296       *@return ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
297       */
298       function GeneratePlot($ImageResource = null, $ChangeSize = false)
299       {
300           //If ImageResource is null
301           if(is_null($ImageResource))
302           {
303               //Get ImageResource
304               $ImageResource = imagecreatetruecolor($this->Height,$this->Width);
305   
306               //AntiAlias ON
307               imageantialias($ImageResource,true);
308   
309               //Fill the image with white
310               imagefill($ImageResource,0,0,imagecolorexact($ImageResource,$this->BackgroundColor[0],$this->BackgroundColor[1],$this->BackgroundColor[2]));
311           
312           }//If ImageResource doesn't fit image and we may not change size
313           elseif($ChangeSize==false&&(imagesx($ImageResource)!=$this->Width||imagesy($ImageResource)!=$this->Height))
314           {
315               //Get ImageResource
316               $ImageResource = imagecreatetruecolor($this->Height,$this->Width);
317   
318               //AntiAlias ON
319               imageantialias($ImageResource,true);
320   
321               //Fill the image with white
322               imagefill($ImageResource,0,0,imagecolorexact($ImageResource,$this->BackgroundColor[0],$this->BackgroundColor[1],$this->BackgroundColor[2]));            
323           }//If we may change the size of the plot
324           elseif($ChangeSize)
325           {
326               //Changing size of the plot.
327               $this->Width = imagesx($ImageResource);
328               $this->Height = imagesy($ImageResource);
329           }
330   
331           //If grid is enabled
332           if($this->EnableGrid)
333           {
334               $this->DrawGrid($ImageResource);
335           }
336   
337           //If axis is enabled
338           if($this->EnableAxis)
339           {
340               $this->DrawAxis($ImageResource);
341           }
342           
343           //Draw caption
344           $this->DrawCaption($ImageResource);
345   
346           //Draw plots
347           $this->DrawPlots($ImageResource);
348   
349           //Return ImageResource
350           return $ImageResource;
351       }
352   
353       /**
354       *Get ImageResource of the plot
355       *
356       *Generates ImageResource representation of the plot.
357       *
358       *@access private
359       *@uses $Width
360       *@uses EvalMath
361       *@uses EvalMath::evaluate()
362       *@uses GetCoordinatX()
363       *@uses GetImageX()
364       *@uses GetImageY()
365       *@uses $Graphs
366       *@uses Graph::$Color
367       *@uses Graph::$LabelFont
368       *@uses Graph::$EnableLabel
369       *@uses Graph::$Label
370       *@param ImageResource &$ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
371       */
372       function DrawPlots(&$ImageResource)
373       {
374           //Get a black Color
375           $Black = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,0,0,0);
376   
377           //Y position for Labels relative to Image
378           $LabelY = 5;
379   
380           //Plot all graphs
381           foreach($this->Graphs as $key => $S)
382           {
383               //Get Color
384               $Color = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,$S->Color[0],$S->Color[1],$S->Color[3]);
385   
386               //Set Expression
387               $m = new EvalMath;
388               $m->evaluate("f(x) = " . $S->Exp);
389   
390               //Set OldCoordinat*, don't start with a line from 0,0
391               $OldCoordinatX = $this->GetCoordinatX(0);
392               $OldCoordinatY = $m->evaluate("f(".$OldCoordinatX.")");
393   
394               //Plot the graph
395               for($ImageX=0;$ImageX<$this->Width;$ImageX++)
396               {
397   
398                   //Get some NewCoordinat*
399                   $NewCoordinatX = $this->GetCoordinatX($ImageX);
400                   $NewCoordinatY = $m->evaluate("f(".$NewCoordinatX.") ");
401   
402                   //Draw a line from OldCoordinat*
403                   imageline(
404                       $ImageResource,
405                       $this->GetImageX($OldCoordinatX),
406                       $this->GetImageY($OldCoordinatY),
407                       $this->GetImageX($NewCoordinatX),
408                       $this->GetImageY($NewCoordinatY),
409                       $Color);
410   
411                   //Get some OldCoordinat*
412                   $OldCoordinatX = $NewCoordinatX;
413                   $OldCoordinatY = $NewCoordinatY;
414               }
415   
416               //Draw label if it is enabled
417               if($S->EnableLabel)
418               {
419                   //Draw label
420                   imagestring($ImageResource,$S->LabelFont,5,$LabelY,"- ".$S->Label,$Color);
421   
422                   //Add Label height to next Label X position
423                   $LabelY += imagefontheight($S->LabelFont);
424               }
425           }
426       }
427   
428       /**
429       *Draw caption to ImageResource
430       *
431       *Draws the caption to an ImageResource representation of the plot.
432       *
433       *@access private
434       *@uses $Width
435       *@uses $Caption
436       *@uses $CaptionFont
437       *@param ImageResource &$ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
438       */
439       function DrawCaption(&$ImageResource)
440       {
441           //Get a black color for caption
442           $Black = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,0,0,0);
443   
444           //width of the caption
445           $CaptionWidth = strlen($this->Caption)*imagefontwidth($this->CaptionFont);
446   
447           //X position of the caption, making it centered
448           $X = ($this->Width-$CaptionWidth)/2;
449       
450           //Draw the caption
451           imagestring($ImageResource,$this->CaptionFont,$X,0,$this->Caption,$Black);
452       }
453   
454       /**
455       *Generates short numbers
456       *
457       *Rewrites numbers into scientific notation, with a certain maximum length.<br>
458       *Example: ShortNumber(501000000) == 5.01e8
459       *
460       *@access private
461       *@param integer $Number The number you wish to shorten.
462       *@param integer $MaxLen The maximum length of the output default to 7.
463       *@return string Scientific notation of the given Number at a certain length.
464       */
465       function ShortNumber($Number, $MaxLen = 7)
466       {
467           //If $Number isn't too long return it as it is
468           if(strlen($Number)<=$MaxLen)
469           {
470               return $Number;
471           }else{
472               //Convert to scientific notation
473               $NSci = sprintf("%e",$Number);
474   
475               //Follwing hack prevents the function from showing too many decimals
476               $ArrNSci = split($NSci,"e");
477               return round($ArrNSci[0],$MaxLen-5) . "e" . $ArrNSci[1];
478           }
479       }
480   
481       /**
482       *Get X grid space
483       *
484       *Returns X grid space, either calculated or from given value if given one.
485       *
486       *@access private
487       *@uses $XGridSpace
488       *@return integer The space between grid on x axes.
489       */
490       function GetXGridSpace()
491       {
492           if($this->XGridSpace==null)
493           {
494               //Text length max 7 when using $this->ShortNumber();
495               $XTextLen = 7*imagefontwidth($this->GridFont) + 10;
496   
497               //Convering to coordinate space
498               return (($this->MaxX-$this->MinX)/$this->Width)*$XTextLen;
499           }else{
500               $XGridSpace = $this->XGridSpace;
501           }
502           return $XGridSpace;
503       }
504       
505       /**
506       *Get Y grid space
507       *
508       *Returns Y grid space, either calculated or from given value if given one. If it is to be calculated,
509       *it is calculated the same way as x axes!
510       *
511       *@access private
512       *@uses $YGridSpace
513       *@return integer The space between grid on y axes.
514       */
515       function GetYGridSpace()
516       {
517           if($this->YGridSpace==null)
518           {
519               //Text length max 7 when using $this->ShortNumber();
520               $XTextLen = 7*imagefontwidth($this->GridFont) + 10;
521   
522               //Convering to coordinate space
523               return (($this->MaxX-$this->MinX)/$this->Width)*$XTextLen;
524           }else{
525               $YGridSpace = $this->YGridSpace;
526           }
527           return $YGridSpace;
528       }
529   
530       /**
531       *Draw grids
532       *
533       *Draws both x and y grid, using DrawXGrid() and DrawYGrid().
534       *
535       *@access private
536       *@uses DrawXGrid()
537       *@uses DrawYGrid()
538       *@param ImageResource &$ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
539       */
540       function DrawGrid(&$ImageResource)
541       {
542           $this->DrawXGrid($ImageResource);
543           $this->DrawYGrid($ImageResource);
544       }
545   
546       /**
547       *Draws x-grid
548       *
549       *Drawing X grid on the plot.
550       *
551       *@access private
552       *@uses GetXGridSpace()
553       *@uses $GridColor
554       *@uses $MinX
555       *@uses $MaxX
556       *@uses $MinY
557       *@uses $MaxY
558       *@uses GetImageX()
559       *@uses GetImageY()
560       *@uses $GridFont
561       *@uses $Height
562       *@uses ShortNumber()
563       *@param ImageResource &$ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
564       */
565       function DrawXGrid(&$ImageResource)
566       {
567           //Get grid width
568           $XGridSpace = $this->GetXGridSpace();
569           
570           //Get color to draw with
571           $Color = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,$this->GridColor[0],$this->GridColor[1],$this->GridColor[2]);
572           //Get text color
573           $Black = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,0,0,0);
574   
575           //Calculate start and end coordinats of the grid
576           $XGridStart = ($this->MinX-fmod($this->MinX,$XGridSpace));
577           $XGridEnd = $this->MaxX-fmod(($this->MaxX-$this->MinX),$XGridSpace);
578   
579           //Draw the grid
580           for($XCordinate=$XGridStart;$XCordinate<$XGridEnd;$XCordinate+=$XGridSpace)
581           {
582               imageline(
583                   $ImageResource,
584                   $this->GetImageX($XCordinate),
585                   $this->GetImageY($this->MinY),
586                   $this->GetImageX($XCordinate),
587                   $this->GetImageY($this->MaxY),
588                   $Color);
589   
590               //If Y axes is not on the image (working in ImageSpace not CoordinatSpace)
591               $Y = $this->GetImageY(0);
592               if($Y > ($this->Height-imagefontheight($this->GridFont)))
593               {
594                   $Y = $this->Height-(imagefontheight($this->GridFont)+2);
595               }else{
596                   if($Y<0)
597                   {
598                       $Y = 0;
599                   }
600               }
601               imagestring(
602                   $ImageResource,
603                   $this->GridFont,
604                   $this->GetImageX($XCordinate)+2,
605                   $Y+2,
606                   $this->ShortNumber($XCordinate),
607                   $Black);
608           }
609       }
610       
611       /**
612       *Draws y-grid
613       *
614       *Drawing y grid on the plot.
615       *
616       *@access private
617       *@uses GetYGridSpace()
618       *@uses $GridColor
619       *@uses $MinX
620       *@uses $MaxX
621       *@uses $MinY
622       *@uses $MaxY
623       *@uses GetImageX()
624       *@uses GetImageY()
625       *@uses $GridFont
626       *@uses $Width
627       *@uses ShortNumber()
628       *@param ImageResource &$ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
629       */
630       function DrawYGrid(&$ImageResource)
631       {
632           //Get grid width
633           $YGridSpace =  $this->GetYGridSpace();
634           
635           //Get color to draw with
636           $Color = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,$this->GridColor[0],$this->GridColor[1],$this->GridColor[2]);
637           //Get text color
638           $Black = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,0,0,0);
639   
640           //Calculate start and end coordinats of the grid
641           $YGridStart = ($this->MinY-fmod($this->MinY,$YGridSpace));
642           $YGridEnd = $this->MaxY-fmod(($this->MaxY-$this->MinY),$YGridSpace);
643   
644           //Draw the grid
645           for($YCordinate=$YGridStart;$YCordinate<$YGridEnd;$YCordinate+=$YGridSpace)
646           {
647               imageline(
648                   $ImageResource,
649                   $this->GetImageX($this->MinX),
650                   $this->GetImageY($YCordinate),
651                   $this->GetImageX($this->MaxX),
652                   $this->GetImageY($YCordinate),
653                   $Color);
654   
655               //If X axes is not on the image (working in ImageSpace not CoordinatSpace)
656               $X = $this->GetImageX(0);
657               if($X > ($this->Width-(imagefontwidth($this->GridFont)*7)))
658               {
659                   $X = $this->Width-(imagefontwidth($this->GridFont)*7+2);
660               }else{ 
661                   if($X<0)
662                   {
663                       $X = 0;
664                   }
665               }
666               imagestring(
667                   $ImageResource,
668                   $this->GridFont,
669                   $X+2,
670                   $this->GetImageY($YCordinate)+2,
671                   $this->ShortNumber($YCordinate),
672                   $Black);
673           }
674       }
675   
676       /**
677       * Draw axis
678       *
679       * Draw both x and y axis to the plot.
680       *
681       *@access private
682       *@uses $MinX
683       *@uses $MaxX
684       *@uses $MinY
685       *@uses $MaxY
686       *@uses GetImageX()
687       *@uses GetImageY()
688       *@param ImageResource &$ImageResource ImageResource representation of the plot.
689       */
690       function DrawAxis(&$ImageResource)
691       {
692           $Black = imagecolorexact($ImageResource,0,0,0);
693           //Draw X-axis
694           imageline(
695               $ImageResource,
696               $this->GetImageX(0),
697               $this->GetImageY($this->MinY),
698               $this->GetImageX(0),
699               $this->GetImageY($this->MaxY),
700               $Black);
701           //Draw Y-axis
702           imageline($ImageResource,
703               $this->GetImageX($this->MinX),
704               $this->GetImageY(0),
705               $this->GetImageX($this->MaxX),
706               $this->GetImageY(0),
707               $Black);
708       }
709   
710       /**
711       *Display plot as image
712       *
713       *Displays plot as image on the page. This makes current http-request return an image. You can set the DisplayType to png, gif or jpeg. Defaults to png, gif not recommanded. Note: this changes the current http-request mimetype to the respective image mimetype.
714       *
715       *@access public
716       *@uses GeneratePlot()
717       *@param string $DisplayType Type of image to view (png|jpeg|gif).
718       *@param ImageResource $ImageResource Defaults to null, will generate empty ImageResource.
719       *@param Boolean $ChangeSize May we change the size of the plot to fit given ImageResource?
720       */
721       function DisplayPlot($DisplayType = "png",$ImageResource = null, $ChangeSize = false)
722       {
723           if($DisplayType == "png")
724           {
725               header("Content-type: image/png");
726               imagepng($this->GeneratePlot($ImageResource, $ChangeSize));    
727           }
728           elseif($DisplayType == "gif")
729           {
730               header("Content-type: image/gif");
731               imagegif($this->GeneratePlot($ImageResource, $ChangeSize));
732           }
733           else
734           {
735               header("Content-type: image/jpeg");
736               imagejpeg($this->GeneratePlot($ImageResource, $ChangeSize));
737           }
738       }
739   
740       /**
741       *Save plot to image
742       *
743       *Saves the plot to an image. You can set the SaveAs to a file type: png, gif or jpeg, defaults to png.
744       *
745       *@access public
746       *@uses GeneratePlot()
747       *@param string $Path Path of file to save.
748       *@param string $SaveAs Filetype definition (png|jpeg|gif).
749       *@param ImageResource $ImageResource Defaults to null, will generate empty ImageResource.
750       *@param Boolean $ChangeSize May we change the size of the plot to fit given ImageResource?
751       */
752       function SaveAs($Path,$SaveAs = "png",$ImageResource = null, $ChangeSize = false)
753       {
754           if($SaveAs == "png")
755           {
756               imagepng($this->GeneratePlot($ImageResource, $ChangeSize),$Path);    
757           }
758           elseif($SaveAs == "gif")
759           {
760               imagegif($this->GeneratePlot($ImageResource, $ChangeSize),$Path);
761           }
762           else
763           {
764               imagejpeg($this->GeneratePlot($ImageResource, $ChangeSize),$Path);
765           }
766       }
767       
768       /**
769       * Convert to coordinate space
770       *
771       * Converts an x image position to x coordinate position. Coordinate space may differ from Image space, if Width!= (MaxX-MinX).
772       *
773       *@access private
774       *@uses $MaxX
775       *@uses $MinX
776       *@uses $Width
777       *@param integer $x X image coordinat to be converted.
778       *@return integer Coordiante space representation given parameter.
779       */
780       function GetCoordinatX($x)
781       {
782           return (($this->MaxX-$this->MinX)/$this->Width)*$x+$this->MinX;
783       }
784   
785       /**
786       * Convert to coordinate space
787       *
788       * Converts an y image position to y coordinate position. Coordinate space may differ from Image space, if Height!= (MaxY-MinY).
789       *
790       *@access private
791       *@uses $MaxY
792       *@uses $MinY
793       *@uses $Height
794       *@param integer $y Y image coordinat to be converted.
795       *@return integer Coordiante space representation given parameter.
796       */
797       function GetCoordinatY($y)
798       {
799           return (($this->MaxY-$this->MinY)/$this->Height)*($this->Height-$y)+$this->MinY;
800       }
801   
802       /**
803       * Convert to image space
804       *
805       * Converts an x in coordinate space to x image position. Coordinate space may differ from Image space, if Width!= (MaxX-MinX).
806       *
807       *@access private
808       *@uses $MaxX
809       *@uses $MinX
810       *@uses $Width
811       *@param integer $x X coordinat to be converted.
812       *@return integer Image position representation given parameter.
813       */
814       function GetImageX($x)
815       {
816           return ($x-$this->MinX)*($this->Width/($this->MaxX-$this->MinX));
817       }
818   
819       /**
820       * Convert to image space
821       *
822       * Converts an y in coordinate space to y image position. Coordinate space may differ from Image space, if Height!= (MaxY-MinY).
823       *
824       *@access private
825       *@uses $MaxY
826       *@uses $MinY
827       *@uses $Height
828       *@param integer $y Y coordinat to be converted.
829       *@return integer Image position representation given parameter.
830       */
831       function GetImageY($y)
832       {
833           return $this->Height-($y-$this->MinY)*($this->Height/($this->MaxY-$this->MinY));
834       }
835   }
836   ?>
Documentation generated on Fri, 13 Oct 2006 06:44:36 +0200 by phpDocumentor 1.3.0RC3
